---
title: "allow_commit.toml"
---

## High-level description
This file is a configuration file in TOML format for a security scanning tool. It defines a rule to detect AWS Access Keys in code or text, with an allowlist for a specific commit.

## Symbols

### Configuration
#### Description
The configuration defines a single rule for detecting AWS Access Keys using a regular expression. It also includes an allowlist to exempt a specific commit from this rule.

#### Internal Logic
1. Sets the title of the configuration
2. Defines a rule for detecting AWS Access Keys
3. Specifies an allowlist for a particular commit

### title
#### Description
A string that provides a brief description of the configuration file's purpose.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| title | string | A descriptive title for the configuration |

### [[rules]]
#### Description
An array of rule definitions. In this case, there is only one rule defined.

### rules.description
#### Description
A string describing the purpose of the rule.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| description | string | A brief description of what the rule detects |

### rules.id
#### Description
A unique identifier for the rule.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| id | string | A unique identifier for the rule |

### rules.regex
#### Description
A regular expression pattern used to detect AWS Access Keys.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| regex | string | A regular expression pattern for detecting AWS Access Keys |

### rules.tags
#### Description
An array of tags associated with the rule for categorization purposes.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| tags | array of strings | Tags for categorizing the rule |

### rules.allowlist
#### Description
Defines exceptions to the rule application.

### rules.allowlist.commits
#### Description
An array of commit hashes or identifiers that are exempt from this rule.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| commits | array of strings | Commit identifiers that are exempt from the rule |

## Dependencies
This configuration file is in TOML format, which implies a dependency on a TOML parser for proper interpretation.

| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| TOML parser | To parse and interpret the configuration file |

## Notes
1. The regular expression used for detecting AWS Access Keys is comprehensive, covering various types of AWS keys (e.g., A3T, AKIA, AGPA, AIDA, AROA, AIPA, ANPA, ANVA, ASIA).
2. The allowlist feature enables exempting specific commits from the rule, which can be useful for handling false positives or authorized exceptions.
3. This configuration is likely part of a larger system for scanning code or text for potential security issues, specifically focusing on detecting exposed AWS Access Keys.
